channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Random glass left + two blue bins, 7th October
item.description:
These blue bins have been reported abandoned via the waste page for sometime. Please can someone pick up. Also someone has left random pane of glass as can be seen. This is additional to the two trolleys left on the same road

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 2, Denman Road, Peckham, London

item.title: Motor homes parked, 7th October
item.description:
Has called in for the 4th time regarding 2-3 Motorhomes/Caravans that are parked Iris Avenue caller claims that one of the people that live in one of the caravans regularly comes out of there in his underwear and she says this is extremely inappropriate especially there being a school down the roadâ€¦caller said they where told someone would get back to her about this and no one has and wanted to raise this further
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 40, Blendon Drive, Blendon, London

item.title: Dangerous wall, 7th October
item.description:
The wall to the back garden of 49 Hamilton Gardens is cracked and now leans out over the property boundary into the pavement space at one side. It is being pushed further out by the very large tree behind it. This looks dangerous and could maim or kill if it fell on someone walking by. The issue has been ongoing for a while, but has been progressive and is now affecting the safety of the public pavement.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 12, Hamilton Gardens, St. John's Wood, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 2 Keslake Road NW6 6DL, 7th October
item.description:
There are two huge overgrown trees that have cause structural damage to our end of terrace house at 2 Keslake Road NW6 6DL. We have have often complained to you about these trees that roots have overgrown by the drought and are causing concerning internal and external concerning cracks on our walls and grounds. Our building surveyor has advised that these street overgrown trees need to be reduced by two third at least.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Keslake Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet
